subject: Re: [junit] assertEquals(File source, File target) ?
msgSnippet: ... I m sure I m missing something - but the point of the assert* family is to abort on failure, return on success. What is the boolean return value supposed
messageBody:
On Wednesday 06 October 2004 18:09, ianatyahoo@... wrote:
> Is there a
>
> boolean assertEquals( f1, f2 ) where the contents
>
> are compared and evaluated ?
> It's easy enough to write one but I'd rather reuse than
> re-invent.

I'm sure I'm missing something - but the point of the assert*
family is to abort on failure, return on success. What is the
boolean return value supposed to represent?

--
Chris "electric hedgehog" Dollin
